title: Feat: What do you think about adding a Rust language server to Remix IDE?
body:
Gm!
Are you going to support Rust on Remix IDE?

We are the [DSRV-based WELLDONE Studio Team](https://welldonestudio.io/), and provide web3 developer tools.
While other networks lack comparable development tools, Remix IDE is only accessible on EVM, whereby there has been a big need from many communities outside EVM to have development tools like Remix IDE.
In order to support the Remix IDE in addition to the EVM network, we are creating a multi-chain builder plugin. ([beta version link](https://docs.welldonestudio.io/code))
However, we're hopeful that the Remix IDE will include Rust grammar/syntax checking as well as these other networks often use Rust to construct contracts.
The Monaco editor of the Remix IDE will thus have a Rust language server integrated into it. 
If Remix IDE supports Rust, there will be a variety of Rust-based plugins accessible.
Can we be permitted to contribute by creating this component?

Your opinion is needed on Remix IDE's graceful transition to a multi-chain IDE!
